meanings.definition: Compartmentalises (verb): to divide into sections or categories
meanings.sent1: She compartmentalises her work tasks to stay organized.
meanings.sent2: The teacher compartmentalises the students into groups for the project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel compartmentalises its nuts in different hiding spots.
meanings.sent4: His mind compartmentalises emotions like a filing cabinet.
meanings.sent5: Compartmentalising the toys by color makes clean-up easier.

meanings.definition: Compartmentalises (noun): a separate section or division within a larger space
meanings.sent1: Each compartmentalises of the toolbox holds different tools.
meanings.sent2: The train has various compartmentalises for passengers to sit in.
meanings.sent3: The lunchbox has small compartmentalises for snacks and sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: The jewelry box has velvet-lined compartmentalises for rings and earrings.
meanings.sent5: The backpack has multiple compartmentalises for books and supplies.
